children.name: surprised
surprised
children.definition: if you are surprised by something that happens, you do not expect it, so it seems strange or unusual: ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ I was really surprised when I passed my driving test first time.
▪ Carrie looked surprised. ‘I didn’t expect to see you here!’
▪ We couldn’t help laughing at the children’s surprised faces.
surprised to see/hear/learn etc: ngạc nhiên khi nghe/thấy/hiểu
▪ We were surprised to see Drew’s picture in the newspaper.
surprised (that) ngạc nhiên rằng
▪ I’m really surprised that he remembered my birthday.
surprised at: ngạc nhiên với điều gì
▪ When I saw him again, I was surprised at how much older he looked.
surprised by: ngạc nhiên bởi
▪ Julia seemed a little surprised by my question.
pleasantly surprised : ngạc nhiên một cách hài lòng
surprised when something unexpectedly good happens
▪ His exam results were great - we were all very pleasantly surprised.

children.name: amazed
children.definition: use this about something that surprises you so much you almost cannot believe it: bị kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ Liz was amazed when she found out how much dinner had cost.

children.name: amazed that: bị kinh ngạc rằng
examples: ▪ I’m amazed that the bank keeps lending him money.

children.name: amazed to see/learn/find out etc: kinh ngạc khi thấy/nhìn/tìm hiểu ra
examples: ▪ We were amazed to see John looking so well, so soon after his operation.

children.name: amazed at/by: ngạc nhiên với/bởi điều gì
examples: ▪ She couldn’t help feeling amazed at his stupidity.

children.name: amazed by: kinh ngạc bởi
examples: ▪ You’ll be amazed by how much progress we’ve made.

children.name: astonished/astounded
children.definition: extremely surprised by something that happens, because it is very unusual or strange: ngạc nhiên, kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ Mark was astonished when he read the message - what on earth could she mean?
▪ We climbed out of the hole right in front of two astounded policemen.

children.name: astonished/astounded (that): ngạc nhiên/kinh ngạc rằng
examples: ▪ It was an extremely nasty accident and I was astonished that anyone had survived it.

children.name: astonished/astounded at/by: ngạc nhiên/kinh ngạc với/bởi
examples: ▪ Everton admits to being astounded at the popularity of the book.

children.name: astonished/astounded to hear/see/discover etc: ngạc nhiên/kinh ngạc khi nghe/thấy/tìm ra
examples: ▪ The whole town was astounded to hear of a plan to build an office building right next to the lake.

children.name: be taken aback
children.definition: to be so surprised or shocked by what someone has done or said that, for a moment, you do not know what to say: ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ I was taken aback to find an elderly woman sitting inside the door of the men’s room.

children.name: be taken aback by: bị làm giật mình/ngạc nhiên bởi
examples: ▪ I was completely taken aback by his aggressive and unreasonable attitude.

children.name: startled
children.definition: especially written surprised and a little frightened or worried because of something that has suddenly happened or something that someone said: giật mình
examples: ▪ ‘Have we met somewhere before?’ The man looked startled for a moment.

children.name: startled by: bị giật mình bởi
examples: ▪ They were startled by a sudden flash in the sky.

children.name: flabbergasted
children.definition: so surprised by something that has happened that you do not know what to say: kinh ngạc, sửng sốt
examples: ▪ The delivery men just left the furniture in my front yard. I was flabbergasted.

children.name: flabbergasted at/by: bị kinh ngạc, sửng sốt bởi
examples: ▪ Doctors said they were flabbergasted at the decision to close the hospital.

children.name: can’t get over
children.definition: if you can’t get over something that has happened, you are so surprised by it that you cannot believe it: quá sửng sốt
examples: ▪ Madge couldn’t get over how much Joe had grown since she’d last seen him.
▪ I can’t get over how much she eats - why doesn’t she gain any weight?

children.name: can’t believe
children.definition: especially spoken say this when you are very surprised by something because it does not seem possible: không thể tin được

children.name: can’t believe itkhông thể tin được
examples: ▪ I can’t believe it! Jane and Richard are getting married.

children.name: can’t believe (that)không thể tin được răng
examples: ▪ She was a brilliant pianist -- we couldn’t believe she was only 15.

children.name: can’t believe your eyes/ears: không thể tin vào mắt/tai
examples: ▪ The letter invited me to fly first class to New York for an interview on Monday - I could not believe my eyes!

children.name: a feeling of being surprised
surprise
children.definition: ngạc nhiên

children.name: somebody’s surprise: sự ngạc nhiên của ai
examples: ▪ You can imagine my surprise when I saw my sister’s photograph on a magazine cover.

children.name: surprise at: ngạc nhiên về cái gì
examples: ▪ I expressed some surprise at the elaborate welcome which had been prepared for me.

children.name: in/with surprise: trong/với sự ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ Sam stared at his girlfriend in surprise. ‘What are you doing here?’ he asked.

children.name: to somebody’s surprise/to the surprise of somebody: khiến cho ai đó ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ To everyone’s complete surprise, the Labour Party lost the election.

children.name: amazement
children.definition: a feeling of great surprise, especially because something has happened that you almost cannot believe: sự kinh ngạc, sửng sốt

children.name: in/with amazement: trong sự kinh ngạc/sửng sốt
examples: ▪ Fans looked on in amazement as Robbins missed a third goal for the team.
▪ Nina looked at me with amazement. ‘I don’t believe you,’ she said.

children.name: to somebody’s amazement/to the amazement of somebody: khiến ai kinh ngạc, sửng sốt
examples: ▪ To our amazement, when we returned to China, the Moso tree had grown an impressive ninety feet.

children.name: astonishment
children.definition: a feeling of great surprise, especially at something you have seen or something someone has told you: kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ You should have seen the look of astonishment on his face!

children.name: in/with astonishment: trong sự kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ Everyone gasped in astonishment as the cars came around the last bend.

children.name: to somebody’s astonishment/to the astonishment of somebody: khiến ai kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ To everyone’s astonishment, more than 100 people volunteered to help that day.

children.name: so surprised that you cannot speak
speechless
children.definition: so surprised, by something very good or very bad, that you do not know what to say: cạn lời, nghẹn lời
examples: ▪ When I told him I was pregnant, he was totally speechless.
▪ Brian’s remark left his boss speechless with anger.

children.name: be lost for words
children.definition: /be at a loss for words  to feel so surprised and full of emotion that you are unable to speak: sửng sốt đến nghẹn lời
examples: ▪ She rang me and told me that Tom had died. For once in my life I was lost for words.
▪ When I saw the devastation from our window in the morning, I was at a loss for words.

children.name: dumbfounded/dumbstruck
children.definition: so surprised by something unexpected that has happened that you are confused and unable to speak: ngớ ngẩn
examples: ▪ I just remember feeling dumbstruck when I heard that John Lennon was dead.
▪ Suddenly the stewardess started screaming while the passengers watched, dumbfounded.

children.name: gobsmacked
children.definition: British informal so surprised that you cannot speak: sửng sốt
examples: ▪ ‘How did you feel when you heard that your wife was expecting triplets?’ ‘Gobsmacked - absolutely gobsmacked.’

children.name: to make sb surprised
surprise
children.definition: làm ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ Diana’s reaction surprised him - he hadn’t realized that she was so upset.
▪ The exam was actually quite easy, which surprised me.
what surprises somebody is: điều làm ai ngạc nhiên là
▪ What surprised me most was how cheap everything was compared to at home.
it surprises somebody that: điều đó làm ai ngạc nhiên
▪ I have to say, it surprises me that they haven’t gone bankrupt before now.
surprise yourself
do something that you thought you could not do, so that you are surprised:tự thấy ngạc nhiên
▪ Why don’t you just have a go at skiing? You might surprise yourself.

children.name: be a surprise/come as a surprise
children.definition: if something is a surprise, or if it comes as a surprise, it surprises you: là một điều kinh kinh

children.name: ▪ ‘Bob and Linda are getting divorced.’ ‘That’s a surprise -- they seemed like the perfect couple.’
examples: ▪ The firing of the team’s star pitcher came as a surprise to fans and sports writers alike.

children.name: a complete surprise a big surprise: là một ngạc nhiên lớn
examples: ▪ My brother’s sudden visit home was a complete surprise.

children.name: be a surprise/come as a surprise to somebody: là một điều kinh ngạc đối với ai
examples: ▪ The announcement of his resignation was a complete surprise to everyone in the office.

children.name: it comes as a surprise to see/learn/find etc: là một điều kinh ngạc khi thấy/học hỏi/tìm ra
examples: ▪ It comes as a surprise to learn what a high rate of illiteracy there is in this country.

children.name: amaze
children.definition: to make someone feel extremely surprised, especially because something is very hard to believe: làm kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ Dave amazed his friends by leaving a well-paid job to travel around the world
it amazes somebody that: điều đó làm ai ngạc nhiên rằng
▪ It amazes me that no-one has thought of the idea sooner.

children.name: astonish/astound
children.definition: to make someone feel extremely surprised: làm kinh nhạc, sửng sốt
examples: ▪ My father’s reaction astounded me. How could he be so calm!
▪ Tammy astonished her doctors by learning to walk again within weeks of the accident.
▪ They astounded audiences with their fanciful costumes and their fascinating tales.

children.name: what astonishes/astounds somebody is: điều làm kinh ngạc/sửng sốt ai đó là
examples: ▪ What astonishes me is how incredibly inefficient so many companies seem to be.

children.name: take somebody by surprise
children.definition: also catch somebody by surprise American   if something takes you by surprise, it happens at a time when you are not expecting it: làm ai ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ The President’s resignation took everyone by surprise.
▪ The vehemence of her response took me by surprise.

children.name: making you feel surprised
surprising
children.definition: ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ A surprising number of teenagers leave school without being able to read and write.
▪ Some of the conclusions in the report were quite surprising.
surprisingly[adverb]một cách ngạc nhiên
▪ The hotel was surprisingly cheap.
▪ Surprisingly, the roof is still in good condition since the storms.

children.name: it is surprising (that) ngạc nhiên rằng
examples: ▪ Wasn’t it surprising that so few people came to the party?

children.name: it is surprising to see/find/ learn etc: ngạc nhiên khi thấy/tìm ra/tìm thấy
examples: ▪ In such a small town it was surprising to find so many really good restaurants.

children.name: it is surprising how/what etc: ngạc nhiên như thế nào/với cái gì
examples: ▪ Liddy really didn’t want to change school, but it was surprising how quickly she got used to the new one.

children.name: amazing
children.definition: very surprising - use this especially about something very good or impressive: đầy kinh ngạc
examples: ▪ Hong Kong is an absolutely amazing city.
▪ What an amazing achievement!
amazingly[adverb]một cách đáng kinh ngạc
▪ Chris was amazingly lucky to pass the exam.
▪ Five cars crashed into each other, but amazingly no-one was hurt.

children.name: it is amazing how/what: đầy kinh ngạc như thế nào/với cái gì
examples: ▪ It’s amazing how much work you can do in a day if you put your mind to it.

children.name: it is amazing that: đầy kinh ngạc rằng
examples: ▪ After 2000 years, it’s amazing that the inscriptions are still clear enough to read.

children.name: it’s amazing to see/find/think etc: thật kinh ngạc khi thấy/tìm ra/ nghĩ rằng
examples: ▪ Isn’t it amazing to think that men have actually stood on the moon?

children.name: astonishing/astounding
children.definition: something that is astonishing or astounding is so surprising that it is difficult to believe: kinh ngạc, sửng sốt
examples: ▪ If you watch the way a spider makes its web, it’s really astonishing.
▪ The submarine was moving through the water at an astonishing speed.
▪ The results of the tests were astounding.
▪ In the area around London, house prices rose by an astounding 200 per cent in three years.

children.name: it is astonishing/astounding that: thật kinh ngạc/sửng sốt rằng
examples: ▪ It was astounding that, as a mother, Sally also managed to do two jobs.

children.name: it is astonishing how/what: thật kinh ngạc/sửng sốt làm sao/với cái gì
examples: ▪ It’s astonishing how much things have changed since the arrival of computers.

children.name: it is astonishing to find/think/realize etc: thật kinh ngạc/sửng sốt khi tìm ra/nghĩ rằng/nhận ra
examples: ▪ Isn’t it astonishing to think that people may one day live for hundreds of years?

children.name: unbelievable/incredible
children.definition: extremely surprising and difficult to believe: không thể tin được
examples: ▪ He’s so rude. It’s unbelievable!
▪ Over the next two weeks, we saw an incredible change in her character.
unbelievably/incredibly[adverb]một cách không thể tin được
▪ Throughout the crisis, Bill remained incredibly calm.
▪ It was a fantastic hotel, and unbelievably cheap.

children.name: it is unbelievable/incredible that: Thật không thể tin được rằng
examples: ▪ They were driving much too fast. It’s incredible that no-one was hurt.

children.name: it is unbelievable how/what: Thật không thể tin được làm sao/với cái gì
examples: ▪ I think it was really unbelievable how he went on deceiving her for all those years.

children.name: it is unbelievable to see/think/realize etc: Thật không thể tin được khi thấy/nghĩ rằng/ nhận ra
examples: ▪ It’s unbelievable to think how slow things were in the days before e-mail.

children.name: unexpected
children.definition: something that is unexpected makes you feel surprised because you did not expect it to happen or be true: bất ngờ
examples: ▪ Her decision to leave was completely unexpected.
▪ The new drug comes from an unexpected source -- potatoes.
▪ Ella’s angry outburst was so unexpected that Mike really didn’t know what to say.

children.name: startling
children.definition: a startling fact is one that you would never have expected to be true: giật mình, hoảng hốt
examples: ▪ There has been a startling increase in the numbers of homeless people.
▪ The programme documents startling new theories about the way the universe began.

children.name: staggering
children.definition: a staggering number or amount is very surprising because it is so large: sửng sốt
examples: ▪ Apparently, we spend a staggering £2.4 billion a year on food for our pets.

children.name: ▪ a staggering rise in crime
examples: ▪ The results of the survey were staggering - over half the children said that they went to school without any breakfast.

children.name: mind-boggling
children.definition: something that is mind-boggling is so big, strange, or complicated that it is almost impossible to imagine or believe: sửng sốt
examples: ▪ The amount of money that some countries spend on weapons is mind-boggling.
▪ His salary is nothing compared to the mind-boggling figures earned by some sportsmen.

children.name: it is mind-boggling to think/realize etc: Thật sửng sốt khi nghĩ/nhận ra rằng
examples: ▪ It’s mind-boggling to think that our solar system is only one among billions.

children.name: st that happens which surprises you
surprise
children.definition: something that you did not expect, especially something nice: ngạc nhiên
examples: it is a surprise: đó là một điều ngạc nhiên
▪ It was a real surprise when Tony walked in. We thought he was still in America.
▪ We’ve got Katie a bike for her birthday, but don’t tell her - it’s a surprise.
a complete surprise : hoàn toàn ngạc nhiên
one that you did not expect at all
▪ Anita didn’t expect to get the job - it came as a complete surprise.
as a surprise: như là một điều ngạc nhiên
▪ Apparently her husband bought her the car as an anniversary surprise.
what a surprise! Thật ngạc nhiên
spoken
▪ Flowers? For me! What a lovely surprise!

children.name: shock
children.definition: something bad or unpleasant that happens to you that you did not expect: sốc
examples: ▪ ‘The bill came to £500.’ ‘That must have been a shock.’
get a shock: bị sốc
▪ We got a terrible shock when the police rang to say that they had arrested our daughter.
give somebody a shock: làm ai bị sốc
▪ It gave me a shock when I realized how close I had come to being killed.

children.name: surprise
children.definition: happening unexpectedly so that people are surprised: ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ Josh’s friends gave him a surprise party to celebrate his 21st birthday.
▪ The US were concerned about the possibility of a surprise attack by air or by sea.
▪ Later, there was a surprise appearance by Schwazenneger himself.

children.name: shock
children.definition: unpleasantly surprising because the result is different from what you expected: sốc
examples: ▪ Liverpool suffered a shock defeat at Halifax last night, beaten by five goals to nil.
▪ The chairman made a shock announcement that 500 employees would lose their jobs.

children.name: not surprising
not surprising/hardly surprising
children.definition: if something is not surprising or hardly surprising, you are not surprised by it because the situation makes it very likely to happen: không quá ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ Now she’s frightened to go out at night, which is hardly surprising after what happened to her.
not surprisingly[adverb]một cách không quá ngạc nhiên
▪ Not surprisingly, she was very annoyed when he didn’t turn up.

children.name: it is not surprising/hardly surprising (that) Không quá ngạc nhiên rằng
examples: ▪ It’s not surprising that you’re tired - you’ve been out every night this week.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise
children.definition: if something is no surprise or comes as no surprise, you are not surprised when it happens, because you expected it to happen: không có gì phải ngạc nhiên

children.name: it is no surprise/it comes as no surprise: không có gì phải ngạc nhiên
examples: ▪ It came as no surprise when President Santos announced his resignation.
▪ Both Jade’s parents are doctors so it was no surprise when she went to medical school.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise that: không có gì phải ngạc nhiên rằng
examples: ▪ After years of struggle, it came as no surprise that the company went bankrupt.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise to: không ngạc nhiên gì
examples: ▪ It was no surprise to anyone when they finally said that they were getting a divorce.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise
children.definition: if something that happens is no surprise or comes as no surprise, it is exactly as you expected, so you are not surprised by it:
examples: ▪ After a series of scandals, Fleischman’s resignation comes as no surprise.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise to
examples: ▪ Tina was shocked when she heard she was not being promoted, but it came as no surprise to the rest of us.

children.name: be/come as no great surprise
examples: ▪ The fact that Brown has decided to run for reelection comes as no great surprise.

children.name: it is/comes as no surprise that
examples: ▪ It’s no surprise that Jeff and his wife are getting divorced.

children.name: be no surprise/come as no surprise to hear/discover/find etc
examples: ▪ It was no surprise to hear that Joel had messed the whole thing up again.

children.name: I’m not surprised
children.definition: say this when you are not surprised about something bad that has happened because you can clearly see the reasons for it: Tôi không bất ngờ lắm
examples: ▪ ‘I’m starving.’ ‘I’m not surprised, you haven’t eaten all day.’
I’m not surprised (that): Tôi không bất ngờ khi
▪ I’m not surprised that she’s fed up with him.

children.name: no wonder
children.definition: say this when you realize the reason why something happened, so that it is not surprising any more: hèn chi
examples: ▪ No wonder my camera wasn’t working - there’s no battery in it!

children.name: I’m not surprised
children.definition: say this when something happens that you expected to happen:
examples: ▪ I’m not surprised she left him - look at the way he treated her!
▪ Of course I’m disappointed that we lost, but I’m not really surprised.
